recipe_text: Quantity; 680; Prepare 680 grams of steak (ribeye, New York strip, or filet mignon)| Measurement; 5; Measure out 5 grams of salt| Measurement; 2; Measure out 2 grams of black pepper| Measurement; 15; Measure out 15 ml of olive oil| Measurement; 28; Measure out 28 grams of butter| Quantity; 2; Prepare 2 garlic cloves| Quantity; 2; Prepare 2 rosemary sprigs| Untimed; None; Pat the steak dry with paper towels and season generously with salt and pepper| Temperature; 120; Preheat a heavy skillet (preferably cast iron) over medium-high heat until it reaches 120 degrees C (248 degrees F)| Timed; 180; Add olive oil to the skillet and sear the steak for 3 minutes on one side| Timed; 180; Flip the steak and sear for another 3 minutes| Untimed; None; Add butter, garlic cloves, and rosemary sprigs to the skillet| Timed; 120; Tilt the skillet and baste the steak with the melted butter for 2 minutes| Timed; 300; Remove the steak from the skillet and let it rest for 5 minutes before serving| Finish; None; Serve the steak with your favorite sides!
title: Pan-Seared Steak
